repository.corpname: Yale University. Department of Manuscripts and Archives

did.abstract: The collection consists of general files, correspondence, publicity materials, scripts, photographs, audiotapes, memorabilia, and financial files relating to The Glines. The records document the administrative and creative functions of the organization and its role in supporting gay arts and artists and AIDS awareness.

accessrestrict.head: Conditions Governing Access
accessrestrict.p: The materials are open for research.

Original audiovisual materials, as well as preservation and duplicating masters, may not be played. Researchers must consult use copies, or if none exist must pay for a use copy, which is retained by the repository. Researchers wishing to obtain an additional copy for their personal use should consult Copying Services information on the Manuscripts and Archives web site.

userestrict.head: Conditions Governing Use
userestrict.p: Copyright has been transferred to Yale University for unpublished materials authored or otherwise produced by the creator(s) of this collection. Copyright status for other collection materials is unknown. Transmission or reproduction of materials protected by U.S. Copyright Law (Title 17, U.S.C.) beyond that allowed by fair use requires the written permission of the copyright owners. Works not in the public domain cannot be commercially exploited without permission of the copyright owners. Responsibility for any use rests exclusively with the user.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: The Glines Records (MS 1920). Manuscripts and Archives, Yale University Library.

relatedmaterial.head: Associated Materials
relatedmaterial.p: John Glines Papers (MS 1895). Manuscripts and Archives, Yale University Library.

bioghist.head: Biographical / Historical
bioghist.p: The Glines was founded in 1976 by John Glines, Barry Laine and Jerry Tobin in New York City. The Glines mission is the production and promotion of gay art, including theater, the visual arts, and poetry. The Glines has won numerous creative and community awards. One of its most notable successes was the production of Harvey Fierstein's Torch Song Trilogy , which won Tony awards for Best Play and Best Actor. Other notable projects include Stamp Out AIDS (1985), a precursor to Broadway Cares: Equity Fights AIDS, and the Gay American Arts Festival.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: The collection consists of topical files, correspondence, publicity materials, scripts, photographs, audiotapes, memorabilia, and financial files relating to The Glines. The records document the administrative and creative functions of the theater and its role in supporting gay arts and artists and AIDS awareness. The bulk of the records document productions and projects.

arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p: The records are arranged by accession.

did.unittitle: "The Glines, a forum for the gay experience..." by John Glines
New York Gay Community Marching Band
Radical Lesbian Feminist Terrorist Comedy Group, photographs

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: The summaries list events and their descriptions by year. Production files, arranged alphabetically, contain publicity material, news clippings, and photographs unless otherwise noted.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: The accession consists of primarily of programs, photographs, correspondence, financial records, and news clippings pertaining to The Glines and its productions. Much of the material appears to have been maintained in scrapbooks that were dismantled prior to transfer.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Material includes awards programs and clippings.

Chambers, Jane and Harvey Fierstein: Human Dignity Award
Bylaws, Board of Directors meeting minutes, financial forms

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Material includes articles, fliers, correspondence, programs, and invitations.

odd.head: General
odd.p: Includes material related to multiple productions including some listed individually below.

did.unittitle: Photograph of John Glines, Jerry Tobin, and Barry Laine at opening night party at Sardi's
Box office records for The Glines
USPS business reply annual permit fee receipt

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: This accession mainly contains materials related to different theater and caberet projects produced by the Glines and often with writing by John Glines. Project materials include scripts, sheet music in draft and final form, and sketches of sets. There is also correspondence, press clippings, and an award won by John Glines for his and his organization's service to the arts and the LGBT community.
